page.title: 10Abbotsley Church clock
page.content: The church clock is about 285 years old. Some of it has been modified in the last century.The clock is wound once a day in the evening.If you are in the tower winding the clock at any o'clock time you get deafened by the noise.There are five bells but only two of them work. One is used for ringing when it is time for a church service and the other strikes the hour.The clock goes by a weight that pulls on a drum that makes the hands go round.The clock stopped at five because two men were wiring the hands up so they would not fall off and five o'clock was home time for them so they stopped it at five o'clock.The weights are about ten kg each.My father and I started it going after it had stopped for five or six years by taking it apart and we cleaned it and repaired it then put it back together.
